thread.title: Soccer: Franzini scores twice in win for Milford girls
thread.title_full: Soccer: Franzini scores twice in win for Milford girls

title: Soccer: Franzini scores twice in win for Milford girls
text: Soccer: Franzini scores twice in win for Milford girls Junior striker Kristen Franzini scored both goals as the visiting Milford girls (6-6-1, 5-6-1 Hock) edged Hockomock League opponent Sharon 2-1 on Friday. Comment   Writer Posted Oct. 16, 2015 at 9:05 PM Updated at 9:05 PM Posted Oct. 16, 2015 at 9:05 PM Junior striker Kristen Franzini scored both goals as the visiting Milford girls (6-6-1, 5-6-1 Hock) edged Hockomock League opponent Sharon 2-1 on Friday. Franzini scored once in the first half, which was assisted by junior midfielder Gabbie Riley, and once 10 minutes into the second half to give Milford a 2-0 lead. Junior goalie Emily Duquette made nine saves for the Scarlet Hawks. FRANKLIN 5, ATTLEBORO 0: Senior striker Alexis Stowell notched a pair of goals, as visiting Franklin (12-0-1, 11-0-1 Hock) blanked Hockomock League opponent Attleboro. Fellow senior strikers Emma Foley and Emily Spath also scored for the Panthers, as did junior defender Abi Gipson. Franklin led 3-0 at the half. LINCOLN-SUDBURY 3, NEWTON SOUTH 0: Hannah Lepordo, Jenna Barnes and Izzy Ross scored first-half goals, and keeper Sage McClure made three saves for her eighth shutout of the season as Lincoln-Sudbury (12-2, 5-2 DCL Large) blanked visiting Newton South in a Dual County League Large game. Lepordo headed in Marissa Bloom’s corner kick in the 17th minute. Seven minutes later, Jenna Barnes converted a clever ball into the box from Emma Garrett. Ross scored after taking a thru pass from Tess Bruner. Center back Jenna King and center midfielder Emily Gorman played outstanding matches for L-S. WESTOROUGH 1, HOLY NAME 0: Maddie French scored off a corner kick in the 10th minute as Westborough (10-4-0) shut out non-league host Holy Name. Hailey Lomois made six saves for the Rangers. VALLEY TECH 3, MONTY TECH 0: Payton Linnehan had a goal and an assist and keeper Tori Socci made six saves for her ninth shutout of the season as Valley Tech (11-3, 8-0 CAL) blanked host Monty Tech in a Colonial Athletic League match. Brianna McMullen and Shannon Kelley scored the other goals for Valley Tech, which led 1-0 at the half. Boys ALGONQUIN 5, SHEPHERD HILL 3: Pat Sullivan’s hat trick led host Algonquin (8-1-4, 4-1-1 Midland B) to a league win over Shepherd Hill. Cole Maslanka and Johnny Hatam also scored for the Tomahawks. WHITINSVILLE CHRISTIAN 1, HOPEDALE 0: Midfielders Mitchell Siefring and Nick Spinelli played well as Hopedale (5-6-1, 2-5-0 Dual Valley Conference) fell in a league game to visiting Whitinsville Christian. FRANKLIN 3, ATTLEBORO 0: Junior striker Kevin Hall scored twice for Franklin, as the host Panthers (9-4, 8-4 Hock) rolled past Hockomock League foe Attleboro. Junior midfielder Hatim Brahimi added a goal and an assist, with senior captain midfielder Austin Kent notching an assist on Brahimi’s goal. Senior goalie Henri Guilmette made five saves and controlled the defense in the win. SHARON 1, MILFORD 0: Senior captain goalie Mike DaSilva made five saves for Milford, but the host Scarlet Hawks (2-10-1, 2-9-1 Hock) allowed a goal in the 70th minute in a defeat to Hockomock League foe Sharon. Page 2 of 2 - VALLEY TECH 3, GRAFTON 0: Senior captain and keeper Mike Homand made nine saves for Valley Tech (7-5-2 overall, 7-2 CAL) in a non-league loss to Grafton. Valley Tech trailed 1-0 at the half. KEEFE TECH 2, PARKER CHARTER 1: Jason Rodriguez’ goal with five minutes remaining gave Keefe Tech (5-5-3, 5-4-3 Colonial Athletic League) a league win at home over Parker Charter. Eric Manjonos scored the Broncos’ first goal, off an assist from Edgardo Mejia. TRI-COUNTY 0, DIMAN 0: Junior goalie Joe Curtiss made six saves to help visiting Tri-County (6-3-5, 1-2-3 Mayflower) earn a draw with Mayflower Small foe Diman. The Cougars also got a standout game from their entire defensive unit.   Writer
